page.title: 02The public image of Hadleigh
page.content: 1 Within living memory, and as far back as the mid-nineteenth century Hadleigh had a very poor reputation for being a rough town. However, more recently the town has seen an influx of Ipswich commuters and small, high-grade industries,and the residents are now keen to improve the town's image and exploit its tourist potential. The area along the R.Brett has been turned into a pleasant walk, as has the old railway line to Raydon. The area around Constitution Hill has been made a nature reserve.
